 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (MediaRecorder)

Detailed Description

MediaRecorder can be used to control recording of audio/video files and streams.

The following example demonstrates how to use the MediaRecorder

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
     // new a instance
     MediaRecorder *mr = new MediaRecorder();

     // new a listener
     MyMediaRecorderListener *mrl = new MyMediaRecorderListener();

     // set a listener
     mr->setListener(mrl);

     // set audio source to Mic
     mr->setAudioSource(MediaRecorder::AUDIOSOURCE_MIC);

     // set output format to 8bit amr
     mr->setOutputFormat(MediaRecorder::OUTPUTFORMAT_AMR_NB);

     // set audio encoder to 8bit amr
     mr->setAudioEncoder(MediaRecorder::AUDIOENCODER_AMR_NB);

     // set a output file path
     mr->setOutputFile(path);

     // start to record a voice
     mr->start();

     // Recording 5 seconds...
     sleep(5);

     // stop to record
     mr->stop();
 }
See also:
MediaRecorderListener

Definition at line 150 of file MediaRecorder.h.

enum gaia::media::MediaRecorder::AudioSource

Defines the audio source.

These constants are used with setAudioSource(int).

Enumerator:
AUDIOSOURCE_DEFAULT 
AUDIOSOURCE_MIC 

Microphone audio source.

AUDIOSOURCE_VOICE_UPLINK 

Voice call uplink (Tx) audio source.

AUDIOSOURCE_VOICE_DOWNLINK 

Voice call downlink (Rx) audio source.

AUDIOSOURCE_VOICE_CALL 

Voice call uplink + downlink audio source.

AUDIOSOURCE_CAMCORDER 

Microphone audio source with same orientation as camera if available, the main device microphone otherwise.

AUDIOSOURCE_VOICE_RECOGNITION 

Microphone audio source tuned for voice recognition if available, behaves like.

See also:
AudioSource::AUDIOSOURCE_DEFAULT otherwise.
AUDIOSOURCE_VOICE_COMMUNICATION 

Microphone audio source tuned for voice communications such as VoIP.

It will for instance take advantage of echo cancellation or automatic gain control if available. It otherwise behaves like DEFAULT if no voice processing is applied.

Definition at line 249 of file MediaRecorder.h.

enum gaia::media::MediaRecorder::MediaRecorderInfoType

informational events for individual tracks, for testing purpose.

The track informational event usually contains two parts in the ext1 arg of the onInfo() callback: bit 31-28 contains the track id; and the rest of the 28 bits contains the informational event defined here. For example, ext1 = (1 << 28 | MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_TYPE) if the track id is 1 for informational event MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_TYPE; while ext1 = (0 << 28 | MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_TYPE) if the track id is 0 for informational event MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_TYPE. The application should extract the track id and the type of informational event from ext1, accordingly.

FIXME: Please update the comment for onInfo also when these events are unhidden so that application knows how to extract the track id and the informational event type from onInfo callback.

Enumerator:
MEDIA_RECORDER_INFO_UNKNOWN 

Unspecified media recorder error.

MEDIA_RECORDER_INFO_MAX_DURATION_REACHED 

A maximum duration had been setup and has now been reached.

MEDIA_RECORDER_INFO_MAX_FILESIZE_REACHED 

A maximum filesize had been setup and has now been reached.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_LIST_START 
MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_COMPLETION_STATUS 

Signal the completion of the track for the recording session.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_PROGRESS_IN_TIME 

Indicate the recording progress in time (ms) during recording.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_TYPE 

Indicate the track type: 0 for Audio and 1 for Video.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_DURATION_MS 

Provide the track duration information.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_MAX_CHUNK_DUR_MS 

Provide the max chunk duration in time (ms) for the given track.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_ENCODED_FRAMES 

Provide the total number of recordd frames.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INTER_CHUNK_TIME_MS 

Provide the max spacing between neighboring chunks for the given track.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_INITIAL_DELAY_MS 

Provide the elapsed time measuring from the start of the recording till the first output frame of the given track is received, excluding any intentional start time offset of a recording session for the purpose of eliminating the recording sound in the recorded file.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_START_OFFSET_MS 

Provide the start time difference (delay) betweeen this track and the start of the movie.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_DATA_KBYTES 

Provide the total number of data (in kilo-bytes) encoded.

MEDIA_RECORDER_TRACK_INFO_LIST_END

static int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::getAudioSourceMax ( ) [static]

Gets the maximum value for audio sources.

int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::getMaxAmplitude ( )

Returns the maximum absolute amplitude that was sampled since the last call to this method.

Call this only after the setAudioSource().

Returns:
the maximum absolute amplitude measured since the last call, or 0 when called for the first time the audio source has been set.
int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::prepare ( )

Prepares the recorder to begin capturing and encoding data.

This method must be called after setting up the desired audio and video sources, encoders, file format, etc., but before start().

int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::release ( )

Releases resources associated with this MediaRecorder object.

It is good practice to call this method when you're done using the MediaRecorder.

int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::reset ( )

Restarts the MediaRecorder to its idle state.

After calling this method, you will have to configure it again as if it had just been constructed.

void gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setAudioChannels ( int32_t  numChannels)

Sets the number of audio channels for recording.

Parameters:
numChannelsthe number of audio channels. Usually it is either 1 (mono) or 2 (stereo).
int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setAudioEncoder ( AudioEncoder  ae)

Sets the audio encoder to be used for recording.

If this method is not called, the output file will not contain an audio track.

Parameters:
aethe audio encoder to use.
void gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setAudioEncodingBitRate ( int32_t  bitRate)

Sets the audio encoding bit rate for recording.

Parameters:
bitRatethe audio encoding bit rate in bits per second.
void gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setAudioSamplingRate ( int32_t  samplingRate)

Sets the audio sampling rate for recording.

The sampling rate really depends on the format for the audio recording, as well as the capabilities of the platform. For instance, the sampling rate supported by AAC audio coding standard ranges from 8 to 96 kHz. Please consult with the related audio coding standard for the supported audio sampling rate.

Parameters:
samplingRatethe sampling rate for audio in samples per second.
int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setAudioSource ( AudioSource  as)

Sets the audio source to be used for recording.

If this method is not called, the output file will not contain an audio track. The source needs to be specified before setting recording-parameters or encoders. Call this only before setOutputFormat().

Parameters:
asthe audio source to use
int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setCamera ( const gaia::media::Camera &  camera)

Sets a Camera to use for recording.

Use this function to switch quickly between preview and capture mode without a teardown of the camera object.

Parameters:
camerathe Camera to use for recording
void gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setCaptureRate ( double  fps)

Set video frame capture rate.

This can be used to set a different video frame capture rate than the recorded video's playback rate. Currently this works only for time lapse mode.

Parameters:
fpsRate at which frames should be captured in frames per second. The fps can go as low as desired. However the fastest fps will be limited by the hardware. For resolutions that can be captured by the video camera, the fastest fps can be computed using gaia::media::CameraParameters::getPreviewFpsRange(gaia::base::Array<int32_t>). For higher resolutions the fastest fps may be more restrictive. Note that the recorder cannot guarantee that frames will be captured at the given rate due to camera/encoder limitations. However it tries to be as close as possible.
void gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setListener ( const MediaRecorderListener &  listener)

Register a callback to be invoked when an informational event occurs while recording.

Parameters:
listenerthe callback that will be run
void gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setLocation ( float  latitude,
float  longitude 
)

Set and store the geodata (latitude and longitude) in the output file.

This method should be called before prepare(). The geodata is stored in udta box if the output format is OutputFormat.THREE_GPP or OutputFormat.MPEG_4, and is ignored for other output formats. The geodata is stored according to ISO-6709 standard.

Parameters:
latitudelatitude in degrees. Its value must be in the range [-90, 90].
longitudelongitude in degrees. Its value must be in the range [-180, 180].
void gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setMaxDuration ( int32_t  max_duration_ms)

Sets the maximum duration (in ms) of the recording session.

After recording reaches the specified duration, a notification will be sent to the

See also:
gaia::media::MediaRecorderListener::OnInfoListener with a "what" code of
MEDIA_RECORDER_INFO_MAX_DURATION_REACHED and recording will be stopped. Stopping happens asynchronously, there is no guarantee that the recorder will have stopped by the time the listener is notified.
Parameters:
max_duration_msthe maximum duration in ms (if zero or negative, disables the duration limit)
void gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setMaxFileSize ( int64_t  max_filesize_bytes)

Sets the maximum filesize (in bytes) of the recording session.

After recording reaches the specified filesize, a notification will be sent to the

See also:
gaia::media::MediaRecorderListener::OnInfoListener with a "what" code of
MEDIA_RECORDER_INFO_MAX_FILESIZE_REACHED and recording will be stopped. Stopping happens asynchronously, there is no guarantee that the recorder will have stopped by the time the listener is notified.
Parameters:
max_filesize_bytesthe maximum filesize in bytes (if zero or negative, disables the limit)
void gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setOrientationHint ( int32_t  degrees)

Sets the orientation hint for output video playback.

This method should be called before prepare(). This method will not trigger the source video frame to rotate during video recording, but to add a composition matrix containing the rotation angle in the output video if the output format is OutputFormat.THREE_GPP or OutputFormat.MPEG_4 so that a video player can choose the proper orientation for playback. Note that some video players may choose to ignore the compostion matrix in a video during playback.

Parameters:
degreesthe angle to be rotated clockwise in degrees. The supported angles are 0, 90, 180, and 270 degrees.
int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setOutputFile ( int32_t  fd)

Pass in the file descriptor of the file to be written.

Parameters:
fdan open file descriptor to be written into.
int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setOutputFile ( const gaia::base::String &  path)

Sets the path of the output file to be produced.

Parameters:
pathThe pathname to use.
int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setOutputFormat ( OutputFormat  of)

Sets the format of the output file produced during recording.

It is recommended to always use 3GP format when using the H.263 video encoder and AMR audio encoder. Using an MPEG-4 container format may confuse some desktop players.

Parameters:
ofthe output format to use. The output format needs to be specified before setting recording-parameters or encoders. setAudioSource()/setVideoSource().
int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setPreviewDisplay ( const gaia::core::SurfaceHolder &  surfaceHolder)

Sets a Surface to show a preview of recorded media (video).

Parameters:
surfaceHolderthe SurfaceHolder to use for the preview

Uses the settings from a CamcorderProfile object for recording.

This method should be called after the video AND audio sources are set, and before setOutputFile().

Parameters:
profilethe CamcorderProfile to use

int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setVideoFrameRate ( int32_t  rate)

Sets the frame rate of the video to be captured.

Must be called after setVideoSource().

Parameters:
ratethe number of frames per second of video to capture

NOTE: On some devices that have auto-frame rate, this sets the maximum frame rate, not a constant frame rate. Actual frame rate will vary according to lighting conditions.

void gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setVideoIFrameInterval ( float  interval)

interval.

int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::setVideoSource ( VideoSource  vs)

Sets the video source to be used for recording.

If this method is not called, the output file will not contain an video track. The source needs to be specified before setting recording-parameters or encoders. Call this only before setOutputFormat().

Parameters:
vsthe video source to use
int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::start ( )

Begins capturing and encoding data to the file specified with setOutputFile().

int32_t gaia::media::MediaRecorder::stop ( )

Stops recording.

Call this after start(). Once recording is stopped, you will have to configure it again as if it has just been constructed.
